results.title: Little Women
results.brief_description: One of the most enduring of the Hollywood movie classics, “Little Women” is based on Louisa May Alcott’s beloved novel. It is the story of four sisters who grow up together in Massachusetts during the Civil War. We enter their world to share their joys and sorrows as they become the “little women” that their father so proudly calls them. Stars Katherine Hepburn, Douglas Montgomery, Paul Lukas, Joan Bennett, Frances Dee and Jean Parker.

results.title: David Copperfield
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, David O. Selznick and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: David Copperfield enjoys an idyllic life with his gentle mother and his loving nurse, Peggotty. Tragedy strikes when Mr Murdstone, a monster of cruelty, weds David’s mother and drives her to an early grave. His adventures from this time introduce us to every stratum of colourful Victorian society. Since its debut in 1935, “David Copperfield” has been acclaimed for its handpicked cast, one that remains unsurpassed to this day. Stars W.C. Fields, Maureen O’Sullivan, Lionel Barrymore, Freddie Bartholomew, May Oliver, Basil Rathbone and over 65 star cast players. Based on the novel by Charles Dickens. Rated: G

results.title: Brigadoon
results.brief_description: The magical world of Brigadoon casts a spell in this exuberant Scottish village that rises out of the Highland mists for just one day in every century. Gene Kelly and Van Johnson star as two jaded New Yorkers who come to Scotland on a hunting expedition and stumble upon the elusive 18th century village. There Kelly falls in love with Brigadoon’s prettiest lass, Fiona, played by Cyd Charisse, and he must decide whether to stay with her forever or return to civilisation. Rating: G

results.title: To the Lighthouse
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of Virginia Woolf’s most popular novel. Set in a delightful holiday home in Cornwall overlooked by a distant lighthouse which holds a haunting attraction for members of this Edwardian family. A compelling story of family relationships.

results.title: Girl groups: the story of a sound
results.creator_credit: Steve Alpert, Stephanie Bennett and Delilah Films
results.brief_description: Traces the story of the dream girls, punctuating over 25 of their greatest hits with fascinating insights into what went on behind the scenes. Highlighted by rare original footage of the groups performing their hits. Includes : The Chantels, The Shirelles, The Shangri-las, Little Eva, The Supremes and more.

results.title: Show Boat
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The 1951 MGM film of the great stage musical, based on the 1926 novel by Edna Ferber, is a charming, beautiful entertainment with an endearing cast, including Kathryn Grayson as Magnolia, Howard Keel as the gambler, Gaylord Ravenal, and Ava Gardner, nominated for an Academy Award, as the tragic Julie Laverne.

results.title: The Day After
results.brief_description: The Day After strips much of the myth from atomic murder to reveal with stark reality the catastrophe of a nuclear holocaust and its torturous effect on a group of average “survivors”. A moving and devastating drama about the effects of nuclear was on the citizens of Lawrence, Kansas. Rated: PG

results.title: Laurel and Hardy's laughing 20's
results.creator_credit: Robert Youngson and Robert Youngson Productions
results.brief_description: In this compilation by Robert Youngson, Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy can be seen in highlights from some of their best work. Included are Putting Pants on Philip’, the film which made them a team;From Soup to Nuts’, in which they create havoc at a dinner party; The Battle of the Century’, with a spectacular custard pie fight; andLeave ‘em Laughing’, in which Laurel suffers a toothache and Hardy suffers Laurel. Includes many more highlights from the career of this famous comic duo. Rated: G

results.title: Gallipoli
results.brief_description: A powerful, poignant military drama, “Gallipoli” focuses on the friendship of two young men (Mel Gibson and Mark Lee) in order to personalise the tragedy of the futile World War I Anzac campaign against the Turks. Excellent performances. Technically perfect.

results.title: Time bandits
results.creator_credit: Terry Gilliam and Handmade Films Partnership
results.brief_description: Time Bandits is a Pythonesque fantasy jaunt through time and space. The 11 year old hero finds his bedroom invaded by amiable, rascally dwarfs, absconding employees of the Supreme Being. They take him on an exhilarating journey through time and space. As might be expected, the giants of history and legend turn out to be engaging eccentrics.
